intro: Echites blanchetii, commonly known as the narrowleaf echites, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows in rocky, arid environments and has small, linear leaves that help reduce water loss. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, and it blooms during the spring and summer months. Echites blanchetii is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
